Corrupt CDs

I had a problem with this when installing only Half-Life 2, but it worked when I installed the full package (with CSS and Steam). Try it, I hope it will solve things.

The RARs

Among all those files there SHOULD be one with a .rar extension (On CD1, it's called vng-hl2a.rar). If you're using Windows it is propably in the "end" of the folders. (Make sure your OS views file extensions. You can also open the file directly with WinRAR, that views file extensions as deafult.)

As for me, the Steam problem is still not solved. I'll just play good old HL 1 :)

Till de som har problem:
1. skaffa daemon tools
2. skaffa winrar
3. unpacka me winrar. Börja med cd1 och med vng-hl2a.r00
4. unpacka sen också vng-hl2b.r00, vng-hl2c.r00, vng-hl2d.r00, vng-hl2e.r00. Obs! det är dubletter i cd2 (skippa de)
5. mounta med daemon vng-hl2a.bin(fösta cd:n) o instalera. När den ber efter en ny cd så mountar du nästa cd.
6. efter att du har instalera fa in i cd5 och i katalogen VENGEANCE och kör hl2install.exe

for those who are still tackling with the install:

1. install steam, do NOT install half life 2 yet
2. let steam update itself
3. after the update, block steam from firewall
4. install half life 2
5. run the hl2install from cd5
6. block hl2.exe from firewall
you're set to go

It was a real bug. Here's what steam says. 
Question 
  I get this error: Error 1334. The file 'hl2.ico1' cannont be installed because the file cannot be found in the cabinet file 'hl24.cab' when I try to install HL2 from my Retail CD
Answer
If you get this error, you need to restart Steam, let Steam update and then restart your installer again.  Steam will rename and update the missing files and your installation should continue normally.
Make sure you install both HL2 and CS:Source (not just HL2).

" Does anyone have the vng-hl2a.r02 of Disc 2? It didn't download :( "

First of all vng-hl2a = disc 1 not 2. Disc 2 is vng-hl2b. Second of all, in this pack, disk 2 folder has a few files from cd 1. Its just a typo bug. Just delete the 5 files in cd2 (the ones that say vng-hl2a.***). Second of all, read the damn nfo. After you install hl from the 5 iso's, explore CD5 and look for the vengience folder. Run the exexutable file that is in there. It will patch everything for you so you dont need to use steam. As for install cab problems, before you install halflife, explore cd-1 and install steam. Let steam update, then use a firewall to block steam from the net (after it updates). Then install halflife and it will work fine.
This release works 100%.

I know people have had problems with the installation for this game so i'll just tell you how it worked for me:
Half Life 2 Install Instructions:

1. Copy images on cd or use virtual drive of choice.
2. Install Disc 1
3. After Install of Disc 1, pause installation process and completely update steam.
4. After Steam update continue on as normal installing the rest of discs, while keeping 
disconnected from the internet.
5. Once finished copy the contents of the vengeance folder on disc 5 into the steam directory.
6. Run hl2install, to completely install half life 2.
7. You are probably going to have crashes when half life 2 saves.  This may not be a problem 
for some but when auto-save is enabled, half life 2 tends to crash frequently.  There is no way to disable auto-save in the half life game itself.  A way around this is to change the attributes in the auto save files to read only in the directory "C:(folder of choice!)ValveSteamSteamAppsUserHalf-Life 2hl2SAVE". Folder of choice, will mostly likely be the program files folder.  You can disable auto save by right-clicking each autosave file and marking the box read only.
8. Run hl2.exe and have fun! :-)
